modules.description: Provides functions for reading from and writing to network flows, with explicit handling of errors and write errors through pretty-printers. Operates on `flow` objects and `Cstruct.t` buffers, supporting both single and vectorized writes. Used to manage data transmission in network protocols, ensuring proper closure and error recovery after I/O failures.

Provides functions for parsing and serializing network packets, including TCP, UDP, and IP headers. Operates on byte sequences and custom record types representing protocol fields. Used to implement protocol-specific logic in network stack components.

Manages network I/O through flow objects and Cstruct buffers, supporting reliable data transmission with error handling and recovery. Offers read and write operations, including vectorized writes, and ensures proper flow closure after failures. Functions work with explicit error tracking and pretty-printed diagnostics for debugging. Examples include sending structured packets, handling partial writes, and recovering from connection drops.
